Package Models

Class EnvironmentModel

java.lang.Object
Models.EnvironmentModel
public class EnvironmentModel
extends Object
EnvironmentModel represents the data structure of the system. The EnvironmentController*** manipulates the data within this class.

  • Method Details

    • createSimulation

      public static EnvironmentModel createSimulation​(House h, HouseGraphic hg, UserProfileModel... profiles)
      Initializes an EnvironmentModel and ensures that only 1 instance of this class exists during runtime
      Parameters:
      h - An instance of House that was initialized with an XML
      hg - An instance of HouseGraphic that is being displayed and must be refreshed when changes occur
      profiles - A list of initial UserProfileModel that will be initialized and available with the simulation.
      Returns:
      An Initialized Singleton of EnvironmentModel

    • resetInstance

      public static void resetInstance()
      Used for testing

      Returns the HouseGraphic displayed to the user
      Returns:
      the house graphic

      Gets house.
      Returns:
      the house

    • setTemperature

      public void setTemperature​(int newTemp)
      Used to set the outside temperature in the simulation
      Parameters:
      newTemp - is the new temperature

    • getAllUserProfiles

      public UserProfileModel[] getAllUserProfiles()
      Returns a deep copy of all the registered user profiles
      Returns:
      UserProfile Array of all registered user profile in the environment

    • modifyProfileLocation

      public void modifyProfileLocation​(UserProfileModel profile, Room room)
      Modifies the room location of the specified user. NOTE: This method only modifies the location on the UserProfileModel that is contained within the internal ArrayList of this class and NOT the reference that is passed in.
      Parameters:
      profile - The UserProfileModel object that needs its location modified
      room - The Room object that represents the new location of the user profile

    • editProfileName

      public void editProfileName​(UserProfileModel profile, String newName, File file)
      Modifies the profile name of the specified user. NOTE: This method only modifies the profile name on the UserProfileModel that is contained within the internal list of this class and NOT the reference that is passed in.
      Parameters:
      profile - The UserProfileModel object that needs its name modified
      newName - The new name of the user profile

    • getCurrentUser

      public UserProfileModel getCurrentUser()
      Returns a deep copy of the currently selected user on the simulation
      Returns:
      Deep copy of currently selected user.

    • setCurrentUser

      public void setCurrentUser​(UserProfileModel currentUser)
      Sets current user.
      Parameters:
      currentUser - the current user

    • getUserByID

      public UserProfileModel getUserByID​(UUID id) throws NonExistantUserProfileException
      Get a copy of a UserProfileModel with the specified UUID
      Parameters:
      id - The UUID of the UserProfileModel that one is looking for
      Returns:
      The UserProfileModel with the specified UUID id
      Throws:
      NonExistantUserProfileException - thrown when the specified UUID is of a user that does not exist

    • getProfilesByCategory

      public UserProfileModel[] getProfilesByCategory​(ProfileType desiredProfileType)
      Returns an array of all the userprofiles that match the specified desiredProfileType
      Parameters:
      desiredProfileType - ProfileType Enum
      Returns:
      Array of UserProfileModel

    • isCurrentUserSet

      public boolean isCurrentUserSet()
      Gets a boolean indicating whether a "Current User" has been selected in the simulator
      Returns:
      true if currentUser is set and false otherwise.

    • addUserProfile

      public void addUserProfile​(UserProfileModel newUser, File userProfilesFile) throws Exception
      Adds a new UserProfileModel to the internal List of this class
      Parameters:
      newUser - The new UserProfileModel to be added
      Throws:
      Exception - if the specified UserProfileModel contains invalid attributes. This includes an empty profile name or non-set ProfileType
